answers.answer: Hi there!Numbness could occur due to a number of issues. A few of these include neuropathy which cold in turn occur secondary to a few conditions like diabetes, micronutrient deficiency etc; nerve impingement/ compression, neuromas, nerve trauma/ injuries etc. It would be best to get this evaluated by a neurologist for an accurate diagnosis and appropriate management.Hope this helpsTake care!

question: Hi,I am a 49 years old woman,since 7 months i am feeling numbness in my fingers,and in the back of my feet..so what it could be the reason and where shall i go or ask...I have heard so many answers...symptoms of menopause,lack of iron and vitamin b,.........or,..and this is what sounds to me most appropriate ,neck problems..so please how you can you help me..
title: numbness
